name: Washington Dulles Airport Marriott

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had looked forward to an outside swim upon our evening arrival. Unfortunately, the (generously sized) outdoor pool was closed – though it wasn’t clear why. The smaller indoor pool was popular with families with pre-teenage children, but – after a short wait – we were able to have a reasonable swim anyway.
reviews.title: Happy to return

reviews.text: At breakfast, no price was displayed alongside the “All American” breakfast, only on the other items. It turned out to be $4 more …
reviews.title: Mixed Review

reviews.text: Apart from those two minor gripes, the hotel was fine, and we’d be happy to return.
reviews.title: OK, but bad shuttle service
Overall "Very Good" because of the great rate, but not a 4 star
reviews.text: We stayed here the night before our flight back to the UK. First impressions were great. We had an enormous amount of luggage (including golf clubs) which we wanted to drop off at the hotel before returning the rental car. The concierge was incredibly helpful with off loading everything and whilst I was left to check in, he followed my husband to the car returns to bring him back to the hotel.
My check in experience was fine, and the room was a decent size with a really comfortable King bed. As we'd got a good rate, we were more than happy.
reviews.title: Dulles Marriott

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don't usually stay at Marriott's themselves, but due to a 7hr layover at Dulles at 1am, I chose this option for maximum sleeps.
reviews.title: Good Stay - Typical 4-Star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Its equivalent to a Hilton (rather than a Hyatt or Wyndham) - clean, a little upscale. Given my late arrival, I didn't get to tour the grounds nor see much, but the room was comfortable and I got a good nights sleep.
reviews.title: 2 Thumbs up!

reviews.text: Breakfast buffet looks awesome, but had to be at airport by 7am so I didn't partake.
reviews.title: Very good hotel

reviews.text: Shuttle was a 2 minute experience - once you got on. Left Hotel for airport every 15 minutes, but late at night many of us were left waiting for 30 minutes for the shuttle to show up despite the hotel being 2 minutes away and knowing that it had guests arriving at 1:20am for the shuttle (3 different couples and 2 pilots) as I requested an after hours pickup. Shuttle showed up at 1:50am. Good thing was the staff whisked me to my room in maybe a minute.
reviews.title: Close to Dulles airport

reviews.text: If on a layover I would recommend this hotel in a heartbeat.
reviews.title: Good Pleasant Overnight

reviews.text: Every staff member I came across, in the halls, lobby, club area spoke to me. Its nice to go to a hotel and encounter folks who really want you to enjoy your stay. Nothing special about the room, but the bed was excellent, seemed like bed and linens were pretty new. The sheets were quite soft.
reviews.title: Extremely friendly staff

reviews.text: Fitness center was a good size, with a variety of equipment.
reviews.title: Good airport hotel

reviews.text: Probably the biggest thing in the Marriott's favor is location. Its a stone's throw from EWD...
reviews.title: Noisy hallway
Convenient for a Long Layover
reviews.text: Our room was nice, thought nothing special. Nice size, clean, well appointed. Not overly new but not especially dated either. Room was decent sized but not huge. Bathroom water pressure was mediocre. Bed was perfect. Price was very good and competitive for the area.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff was friendly and efficient.
reviews.title: Beyond My Expectations

reviews.text: Very attentive & helpful staff; pretty good restaurant, service to match; rooms are okay in need of some repairs; TV excellent; clean; BUT my pillows had been washed way too many times and felt like a pillow sack filled with small rocks. Overall, I was pleased as it was a much better an experience for the DC area than a Motel 6, for sure.
reviews.title: "Average for a Marriott - but 4 Stars for the Average Hotel.

reviews.text: This is the perfect place to stay if you have one-night layover. The place is beautiful, modernly designed. The staff is very friendly, from manager to the housekeeper. The bar seems to be a nice and fun place for guests to mingle. They have airport shuttle every 15 minutes starting 4AM, which is the most important service for me. I'm not impressed with the quality of the TV.
reviews.title: Friendly Staff

reviews.text: I made a reservation at a different Marriott in the Dulles area and didn't realize my mistake until I tried to check in at the Dulles Airport Marriott. I was pretty annoyed with my stupidity because I'd have to load up all my bags and drive farther down the road to the correct hotel. Manal, a customer service rep at the front desk, went the extra mile on his own initiative by calling the other hotel, having them cancel my rez with no penalty, and booking me into the Dulles Marriott. He took a bad situation that was totally my fault and saved the day for me. I truly appreciated his expert help.
reviews.title: Unparalleled customer service

reviews.text: The room I was in was excellent! I believe it was a standard room, but the bed was extremely comfortable, the room was as quiet as a tomb, and the air conditioning/ventilation was fine.
reviews.title: Great Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definitely recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Convenient and confortable stay

aka: Washington Dulles Airport Marriott Hotel Dulles
